
p = PRIMES (200)
// p = PRIMES (2000)
INFINITY = LENGTH p

// zeta (2,3,4,5,6)
// zetaValues = (1.642936065514894,  1.202054907155594,  1.0823232310524604, 1.0369277551393863, 1.017343061984441)
// zetaValues = (1.6447251902386738, 1.2020568222487159, 1.0823232336613627, 1.0369277551433337, 1.0173430619844492)
// zetaValues = (1.6448381469037244, 1.2020568847190002, 1.0823232337054985, 1.0369277551433679, 1.0173430619844492)
zetaValues =    (1.6449340668482264, 1.2020569031595942, 1.0823232337111381, 1.0369277551433699, 1.0173430619844492)

// Euler's Infinite Product Representation
!! ipr (n) = PI [0 <= i < INFINITY] ( 1 / ( 1 - p#i ^ (-n) ) )  

zetaCalc = [2 <= k <= 6] ( ipr (k) )

calc zetaValues
calc zetaCalc

calc zetaCalc - zetaValues


// for 2000 primes:
// (1.6449340668482260, 1.2020569031595940, 1.0823232337111380, 1.0369277551433700, 1.0173430619844490)
// (1.6448381469037244, 1.2020568847190002, 1.0823232337054985, 1.0369277551433679, 1.0173430619844492)
// (-0.0000959199445017, -18.4405939E-9, -5.6395730357733560E-12, -2.1200827296346850E-15, 1.3890643934542540E-16)
